heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this stunning 3-bedroom bungalow located in the sought-after Finestrat Hills. areaSection: Finestrat is a charming coastal municipality nestled between Benidorm and Altea on the Costa Blanca's most picturesque stretch. This whitewashed village sits dramatically against the backdrop of the Sierra de Aitana mountains, creating a stunning visual contrast with the Mediterranean Sea. The area enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine, with mild winters (average 12°C) and warm, dry summers (average 28°C). Finestrat has maintained its authentic Spanish character while welcoming an international community, offering the best of both worlds. The town is renowned for its pristine beaches awarded Blue Flag status, excellent local restaurants serving fresh seafood and traditional Spanish cuisine, and a thriving cultural scene with regular festivals and events. The combination of natural beauty, climate, and accessibility has made Finestrat increasingly popular with discerning property buyers seeking genuine Mediterranean living without the overdevelopment found in nearby tourist hotspots.
lifestyleSection: Life in Finestrat revolves around the perfect balance of relaxation and activity. Your mornings might begin with a coffee at a beachfront café before exploring local markets abundant with fresh produce, or you might head to one of several championship golf courses for a leisurely round. The established international community means English is widely spoken, and you'll find restaurants catering to diverse palates alongside authentic Spanish tapas bars. Afternoons are ideal for beach time—multiple Blue Flag beaches are within 20 minutes—or exploring the charming village center with its boutique shops and galleries. Healthcare is accessible with English-speaking doctors available and regional hospitals nearby, ensuring peace of mind for residents. The expat community is well-integrated and welcoming, with numerous social groups and activities organized throughout the year. Evenings might feature fresh seafood dinners overlooking the Mediterranean, or quiet relaxation by your property. Shopping is convenient with major supermarkets including Mercadona and Lidl, supplemented by traditional weekly markets. The slower pace compared to nearby Benidorm makes Finestrat perfect for those seeking genuine relaxation without sacrificing modern conveniences.
investmentSection: This property represents a sound investment opportunity in a market experiencing sustained growth. Costa Blanca real estate values have appreciated 8% year-on-year, with Finestrat positioned as one of the region's most desirable locations. The €399,900 price point delivers excellent value—at €4,650 per square metre, it's 40% less expensive than comparable premium properties in Spanish island markets like Ibiza or Mallorca, yet offers similar quality and lifestyle benefits. The rental market is particularly strong, with comparable 3-bedroom properties in Finestrat commanding approximately €800 per week during peak season (7-night rentals). This translates to substantial income potential if you choose to let the property during months when you're not using it personally. The established tourism infrastructure, Blue Flag beaches, and international appeal create consistent demand from holiday renters. Property ownership in Spain by foreigners is straightforward, with no restrictions on EU citizens and accessible options for non-EU buyers. The area's continued development and international recognition suggest strong long-term appreciation potential.

At €399,900, you're acquiring a property 40% less expensive than island alternatives while enjoying authentic coastal living, investment growth potential, and direct access to pristine beaches and world-class amenities. The nearest major hospital, Hospital Marina Baixa, is located in Villajoyosa approximately 15 km away (20-minute drive), offering full emergency and specialist services. Several private clinics operate within Finestrat itself, providing faster access for non-emergency care. Many doctors and healthcare professionals speak fluent English, understanding the needs of the international community. Prescription medications are widely available through local pharmacies, identifiable by the green cross symbol. EU residents benefit from reciprocal healthcare arrangements with Spain's national system. For routine healthcare, local health centers provide accessible, affordable services. Comprehensive private health insurance is available and recommended for optimal peace of mind.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain with no restrictions. EU citizens have identical rights to Spanish citizens. Non-EU foreign buyers can also purchase residential property in Spain without requiring special permission. The process is straightforward through a Spanish notary and property registry, with many legal advisors experienced in international transactions. Your purchase will be protected by Spanish law and property ownership records.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent location for property investment and lifestyle purchases. The region has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year property value appreciation. It offers world-class beaches, year-round Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine, established international communities with English widely spoken, excellent healthcare and education, and strong rental income potential for holiday lettings. The combination of affordability, lifestyle benefits, and investment returns makes it highly attractive.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers a significantly lower cost of living compared to Northern Europe. Grocery costs are 30-40% less than UK prices, with fresh produce particularly affordable from weekly markets. Dining out costs €12-20 for quality meals, utility bills are substantially lower due to minimal heating requirements, and healthcare is accessible and affordable. This property's location ensures you're in an area with good value without sacrificing quality or amenities.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean weather with over 300 days of annual sunshine. Winters are mild (average 12°C) with occasional rain, making it perfect for escaping grey northern climates. Summers are warm and dry (average 28°C) with low humidity and sea breezes providing natural cooling. Spring and autumn offer ideal weather for outdoor activities. This consistent, pleasant climate is one of the region's major attractions for holiday homeowners.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is approximately 2.5 hours flight time from London and major UK airports. Regular budget and scheduled airline flights operate daily, with return flights often available for under €100 during off-peak periods. The short flight time makes Costa Blanca easily accessible for regular visits, making it perfect as a second holiday home.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain mortgages in Spain through Spanish banks. EU citizens and residents typically qualify for mortgages covering 60-80% of property value, with competitive interest rates. Non-EU citizens may face slightly stricter requirements but mortgages are available. Many international mortgage brokers specialize in Spanish property financing. This property's price point and location make it attractive for mortgage lenders.

faqs.question: What rental income could I earn from this property?
faqs.answer: Comparable 3-bedroom properties in Finestrat typically achieve €800+ per week during peak season (7-night minimum rentals). This translates to approximately €2,600-3,200 monthly during summer months. Off-season rates are lower but still meaningful, with annual rental income potential of €20,000-30,000 for owners utilizing professional holiday lettings management. The established tourism infrastructure and Blue Flag beaches support strong demand.

faqs.question: Is Finestrat good for retirees?
faqs.answer: Yes, Finestrat is increasingly popular with retirees seeking Mediterranean lifestyle. The mild climate eliminates harsh winters, healthcare is excellent with English-speaking medical professionals, the expat community provides social integration, beaches and outdoor activities support active retirement, and cost of living is substantially lower than Northern Europe. The relaxed pace, cultural events, and established international community make it ideal for retirement.

faqs.question: What makes Finestrat better than Benidorm for a holiday home?
faqs.answer: While nearby Benidorm offers more nightlife and tourism infrastructure, Finestrat provides authentic Mediterranean living with retained Spanish character, smaller crowds, comparable beach quality with Blue Flag designations, and a more relaxed atmosphere. Finestrat maintains the benefits of proximity to Benidorm's amenities while offering genuine tranquility. For holiday homeowners seeking genuine lifestyle experience over resort tourism, Finestrat's combination of accessibility and authenticity is superior.
